page.title: 18 The River Weaver
page.content:
Sun dances on the water like fairies, With their shining wands. Twisting and turning as a snake, Ripples small waves in it's body. Silence cracked by traffic. And the waters quiver,erupting volcano like. Washing weeping willows by the water, And lamposts are creatures, From war of the worlds, The light a shining eye, Looking at me from the water.
This is a poem about the River Weaver which runs through Winsford and has its scource in Shropshire. The River Weaver joins the River Mersey.
